bill_title: transfer funds from the special racing revolving fund and the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Education for certain technology enhancement programs and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to transfer funds from the special racing revolving fund and the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Education for certain technology enhancement programs and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Commission on Gaming on or about July 15, 2000, shall transfer three hundred seventy-five thousand ($375,000) from the special racing revolving fund and six hundred twenty-five thousand dollars ($625,000) from the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs in order to provide funding for enhancing technology-based capabilities of K-12 schools in the areas of teaching, learning, and network administration. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated one million dollars ($1,000,000) of other fund expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs for the expenditure of funds provided in section 1 of this Act. Section 3. The secretary of education and cultural affairs shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2001, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
